taskbody.context:
This tutorial shows you how to create a WebUI test case using the in . You can perform all the desired actions as a real user on your website while the records them.
The application under test (AUT) is the CURA Healthcare Service demo website: https://katalon-demo-cura.herokuapp.com/. We create a test to verify the successful login to the demo website. The basic steps are:
Open the AUT in a browser.
Click Make Appointment.
Enter username and password to sign in.
Click Login.
Verify whether the Make appointment heading appears after the successful login.
Close the application.
The test is successful if we successfully sign in the CURA Healthcare Service demo website.
You can clone the sample project here: Healthcare sample.

step.cmd: Enter the demo website URL: https://katalon-demo-cura.herokuapp.com/.
Select a browser to start recording. Here, we choose the Chrome browser.
step.info: You can click Expand, then click Show Captured Object to see recorded steps and captured objects while recording.

step.cmd: Click Record. Wait until the browser is launched and ready to interact.
step.info: When you hover an element, the element is highlighted and displays its correspondent XPath on the top of the page.

step.cmd: Record the test script as planned.

substep.cmd: Click on Make appointment, fill in the demo username and password, then click Login.
To verify the Make appointment heading after the successful login, mouse over the Make appointment text, right-click > Katalon Studio > Verify Element Present.

step.cmd: Once done, click Save script to stop recording and save the captured objects. exports a list of objects captured in the test case in .
step.info: Create a new folder or select an existing one in the Object Repository, then click OK.

step.cmd: A pop-up dialog prompts you to name a new test case. Here, we name it TC1_Verify Successful Login.

taskbody.result: You have successfully recorded a WebUI test case using in .
